name: iris-thaumantias
description: Artemis brings interactive learning to life with instant, individual feedback on programming exercises, quizzes, modeling tasks, and more. This VS Code extension integrates Iris, an LLM-based virtual assistant that supports students with instant answers about exercises, lectures, and learning performance. Iris provides context-aware, personalized assistance for programming exercises, encouraging independent problem-solving through subtle hints and guiding questions instead of giving full solutions.

artemis.serverUrl.description: The URL of the Artemis server to connect to
artemis.serverUrl.patternErrorMessage: Server URL must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL

enumDescriptions: VS Code native styling that matches the editor's appearance
Clean, card-based design inspired by modern web applications
Retro-futuristic neon aesthetic with synthwave styling
artemis.theme.description: Choose the visual theme for Artemis views

artemis.showIrisExplanation.description: Show the 'How to use Iris' explanation on the dashboard

artemis.iris.sendUncommittedChanges.markdownDescription: Allow Iris to access your uncommitted file changes (unsaved, unstaged, and unpushed files). When enabled, Iris can see your current work-in-progress code to provide better assistance. **Privacy**: Only files from your current workspace are sent, and only when you send a message to Iris.

artemis.hideDeveloperTools.description: Hide developer tools and debugging buttons

artemis.defaultCommitMessage.description: Default commit message used for automatic exercise submissions (shown when submitting without a custom message)

artemis.showUnsavedChangesWarning.description: Show a warning banner when there are unsaved changes in the workspace before submitting

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
